text: HIRD UNDAY OF ENT ARCH 7 2021 Entering into the Third Sunday of Lent March 6th 7th we would now normally begin the Lenten Scrutinies The yearly scrutinies are moments of intense prayer by our parish family for those preparing to be baptized at the Easter Vigil This would also change our Gospel readings for the coming weekends taking extended readings from Year though we are in Year of the threeyear lectionary cycle This year however we do not have any catechumens in our RCIA program or those adults preparing for baptism As such we will continue to follow the lectionary readings for Year Though we do not have any catechumens this year we do have several Candidates for Full Communion who have participated in RCIA and other catechetical instruction These individuals having been baptized with the Trinitarian formula in other denominations are now seeking to enter into full communion with the Catholic Church at the Easter Vigil Though they will not undergo the formal Lenten Scrutinies let us continue as a parish family to keep these individuals in our prayers throughout the remainder of this Lenten Season as they prepare to join us at the altar ENTEN ARISH ISSION Our Lenten Parish Mission will be held from Monday March 29th through Wednesday March 31st at 7:00pm offered both inperson in the Church and via livestream This mission will enter us into Holy Week and lead us into the Sacred Paschal Triduum with a special focus on the Sacrament of Confession We will also be utilizing several different approaches for these three days Viewing the FORMED.org threepart 90minute series Forgiven The Transforming Power of Confession Participating in discussion on the Sacrament of Confession Joining together in Mass with a homily focused on the Sacrament of Confession On Monday March 29th we will view parts one Where are You and two An Encounter with Mercy of the Forgiven series and have the opportunity for discussion following On Tuesday March 30st we will view part three Embrace in Mercy The Rite Explained the final part of the Forgiven series Afterwards we will host a liveviewing of the Chrism Mass for those who wish to view it in the Church livestreamed from the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Fort Wayne On Wednesday March 31st we will have our evening 7:00pm Mass with an extended homily focused on the Sacrament of Confession The Forgiven series is a wonderful exploration into the grace and healing offered in Confession and shows how this sacrament of mercy reveals the depth and bounty of Gods love By looking at Gods revelation of his mercy in Scripture and making a stepbystep examination of the Rite itself Forgiven communicates Gods invitation to each one of us to come experience his indescribable love in the Sacrament of Reconciliation PCOMING ROJECT LOWER ARDEN EDS With approval from our Parish Council we are planning to build several raised beds for flowers and gardening space behind the Church to the side of our pole barn as the weather warms These beds will allow us to grow fresh flowers for use in the Church and can also be used by parishioners as a form of community garden If you would be interested in helping to construct the raised beds provide supplies or assist with the gardening and upkeep of the beds please contact the Parish Office 8241380 Faithfully in Christ Fr David MASS INTENTIONS
